attributes.action: introduce a system whereby MPs' salaries reflect the amount of time spent in the House of Commons or doing MP work.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We are all familiar with watching newsclips of Prime Minister's Questions, the weekly shouting shop in front of a full house of MPs.  We are also familiar with watching clips of an empty House when other matters are under debate.
Why should our MPs be paid for not being there?
I propose a flat rate - perhaps 20% of the current MP salary - with the remainder to be made up to its current total (so no conscientious MP will lose out) by an audited attendance allowance (not the MEP model!) and payments for activities such as surgeries and other constituency events.
Basically: MP wants the money - MP does the work.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
